page.title: 19CROSSFIELD FARM
page.content: In summer 1984,Durleigh Brook ran dry. Mrs.Dosson and her two sons had to bore a hole for water.The first estimation was 100 ft but they had to drill an extra 33 ft before water was reached.This water was reached.This water was pumped into a tank by means of a immersible pump.The water is soily.The animals drink the water,which keeps the water flowing.Crossfield farm has forty cows min. 200 cows max.A five month old cow costs Â£200,a fully grown cow costs Â£600 and a bull can cost Â£2,000.The calves at eleven months are sold at highbridge market.The butchers buy them from there.Cows are fed hay and silage,but this year they are to be fed on barley,because of the excessive grain stores.
